page.title: 17RECREATION IN CONGRESBURY
page.content: There are many clubs and activities in Congresbury for people of all ages, from the youngest to the oldest.There are 2 Playgroups. Cubs, Brownies, Scouts and Guides meet in the Scout hut,the 'Over 60's Club'meet in the Old school rooms.The Parish Council also meet there.The Drama group put on plays and pantomimes,the Horticultural Society hold Spring, Summer and Autumn shows. The King George Vth. playing field is often called the'Fort'because one was built for the children to play on. There are also swings,a seesaw and a slide.There are cricket squares, football pitches and floodlit tennis courts.At Urchinwood Manor there is a large stable and equestrian centre. The village schools run many sports teams and activities.Churchill Comp. school has a sports centre and pool.
